item.title: Differential Equations and Matrix Exponentials
item.description: 20.1 Differential Equations $\frac{du}{dt} = Au$ Example: Let the system of differential equation to be solved is: $\frac{du_1}{dt} = -u_1 + 2u_2; \frac{du_2}{dt} = u_1 - 2u_2$ with initial condition of $u(0) = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \end{bmatrix}$. The matrix $A$ representing the coefficients of the equation is $A = \begin{bmatrix} -1 & 2 \\ 1 & -2 \end{bmatrix}$. The eigenvalues of the matrix $A$ satisfies the equation $\lambda_1 + \lambda_2 = -3; \lambda_1 \times \lambda_2 = 0$, i.
